alert.note: Alert for Sevier (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 09 at 3:55PM CDT until September 09 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall from thunderstorms continues. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following county, Sevier. * WHEN...Until 545 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 452 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is expected to be ongoing in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in the past 2 hours. Lighter rainfall was now occurring in parts of the area. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area during the next hour. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that may still experience minor flooding include... Sevierville, Gatlinburg, Pigeon Forge, Wears Valley, Roundtop Mountain State Park, Elkmont, McMahan, Seymour, Kodak and Great Smoky Mountains National Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
